lexUnit.name: sick.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: affected by physical or mental illness.

sentence.text: That help makes all the difference to people sick with AIDS who want to stay at home , rather than spend time unnecessarily in hospital .
A row of epic proportions had ensued , which he and Angela had evidently enjoyed but which had left Sarah and Jennifer sick with distress .
Heartsore and vulnerable and sick with misery .
At other times it may be by anointing the sick person with oil .
He was sick and sour with rage .
It made me sick with anger . "
Not one of them looked as though they were not sick to their stomachs with jealousy of someone or something .
A British firm pledged yesterday to send medical supplies to Sarajevo after she passed on an appeal from doctors treating sick babies in the besieged city .
And £18.50 is enough to pay for a year 's supply of medicine and special foods for a sick child in San José .

He gets sick on trains . "

He was sick to his stomach .
